Indology

Formal description of Indology, general subclasses, related classes, and properties.
Turtle | RDF/XML | N-Triples | JSON-LD | GitHub
indology
a
owl:Ontology
dct:contributor
Magdalena Plamada, PhD, Zürich University, Switzerland
dct:creator
Hans Cools, MD, knowledge engineer, ontologist, software developer, Basel University, Switzerland
dct:description
Formal description of Indology, general subclasses, related classes, and properties.
dct:license
http://creativecommons.org/ licenses/ by/ 3.0/
dct:publisher
Universities of Basel, Bern, and Zürich, Switzerland
dct:title
An ontology about Indology
owl:versionInfo
2020-06-11

Classes

indology:Expression
a
rdfs:Class
rdfs:comment
Literary expression created in Indian culture.
and
Literarische Expression in indischer Kultur kreiert. (de)
rdfs:isDefinedBy
indology
rdfs:subClassOf
literature:Expression
indology:Literature
a
rdfs:Class
rdfs:comment
Literature in Indian culture.
rdfs:isDefinedBy
indology
rdfs:subClassOf
literature:Literature
indology:Padapatha
a
rdfs:Class,
indology:Patha
rdfs:comment
One of the eleven Pathas, with a word by word recitation, marked by a conscious pause after every word, and after any special grammatical code embedded in the text; suppresses euphonic combination and restores each word in its original intended form.
rdfs:isDefinedBy
indology
indology:Patha
a
rdfs:Class
rdfs:comment
Style to recite or chant a Vedic mantra in the oral tradition of the Vedas, enabling its memorization.
rdfs:isDefinedBy
indology
rdfs:label
patha (en)
,
Patha (de)
and
pāṭha (sa)
skos:note
There are eleven Pathas, with increasing difficulty, divided in 3 simpler or natural, and 8 complex ones.
owl:oneOf
indology:Samhitapatha
,
indology:Padapatha
,
indology:Kramapatha
,
indology:Jatapatha
,
indology:Maalaapatha
,
indology:Sikhapatha
,
indology:Rekhapatha
,
indology:Dhwajapatha
,
indology:Dandapatha
,
indology:Rathaapatha
and
indology:Ghanapatha
rdfs:subClassOf
rdfs:Resource
indology:Samhita
a
rdfs:Class,
indology:VedaLiterature
rdfs:comment
One of the four text styles, and the oldest part, in a Veda, wherein text or verses are methodically put together.
rdfs:isDefinedBy
indology
rdfs:label
Samhita (en)
,
Samhita (sa)
and
Samhita (de)
indology:Veda
a
rdfs:Class
rdfs:comment
Hindu text written in Vedic Sanskrit, in a period dated roughly from 1700 to 400 BC.
rdfs:isDefinedBy
indology
rdfs:label
Veda (en)
and
Veda (de)
rdfs:subClassOf
indology:Expression

rdfs:Class
rdfs:comment
Indian literature in a Veda.
rdfs:isDefinedBy

,

,

Instances

indology:Samhitapatha
a
indology:Patha,
rdfs:Class
rdfs:comment
One of the eleven Pathas, with continuous recitation of Sanskrit words bound by the phonetic rules of euphonic combination.
rdfs:isDefinedBy
indology

Properties

indology:hasIndologicCommentLiteral
a
owl:DatatypeProperty
rdfs:comment
Relating something to the literal of an Indological comment as a textual statement about that something.
rdfs:domain
rdfs:Resource
rdfs:isDefinedBy
indology
rdfs:range
rdfs:Literal
rdfs:subPropertyOf
text:hasCommentLiteral
